content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────────────────
### Extraction System Belt Network (Representative position: –3.5, 27.5)
Consists of the following interconnected entities used to convey extracted items toward the depot:
• Extraction system burner inserter at (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5)
• Depot wooden chest (belt depot) at (3.5, 15.5)
• Dedicated transport belt segment at (4.5, 15.5) placed adjacent to the depot chest
• Depot burner inserter at (3.5, 14.5) using direction UP (pickup at (3.5, 15.5) and drop at (3.5, 13.5))

### Copper Cable Factory (Reference position: 2.5, 17.5)
This production setup is designed for copper-cable manufacturing and integrates material input with assembly:
• Cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)
• Factory burner inserter at (3.5, 17.5) using direction RIGHT with drop position at (4.5, 17.5); this unit is linked with an adjacent new factory burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5)
• Assembling machine (assembling-machine-1) at (1.5, 19.5) operating with a copper-cable recipe

### Electricity Generator (Position: –0.5, 24.5)
This structure provides power generation through the coordinated use of fluid and mechanical components:
• Boiler at (–5.5, 24.0) (steam output directed from approximately (–5.5, 22.5))
• Offshore pump at (–7.5, 25.5)
• Steam engine (generator) at (–0.5, 24.5)

### Smelting Facility (Approximate positions: –3.0, 19.0 and –4.0, 21.0)
A basic smelting setup converting ore into plates:
• Stone furnace at (–3.0, 19.0) producing iron plates
• Stone furnace at (–4.0, 21.0) producing copper plates

### Laboratory (Position not specified)
A standalone experimental unit for research inputs:
• Laboratory with lab_input {'automation-science-pack': 17}, electrical_id 7106, and status NO_POWER

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────────────────
• Belt Connection Target Error:
  – Repeated failures occurred when attempting to connect transport belts directly to a steam engine (Prototype.SteamEngine) as a target.
  – Tip: Always add an intermediary inserter that feeds items into the steam engine rather than connecting the belt directly.

• Placement Range Error:
  – The attempt to place a wooden chest at (3.5, 15.5) failed because the target position was too far from the player’s current location.
  – Tip: Ensure the player moves close enough to the intended placement position to be within the maximum allowed distance.

• Inventory Availability Error:
  – An error occurred when trying to place a wooden chest after moving, indicating that no wooden chest was present in the inventory.
  – Tip: Verify that the required entity is available in the inventory before attempting a placement.

• Variable Naming Error:
  – A NameError was raised due to an undefined variable (‘target_chest’) being used.
  – Tip: Double-check variable names and ensure that all identifiers are properly defined and referenced.
